column4: Hi everyone! When I open my gnome-terminal the 'box' is empty, what can I do?  It does not output the "user@host" stuff in the beginning.
What about sometime later, after this beginning?
Hi thanks for reply, The whole box is empty.
Do you happen to have desktop effects enabled in sys>prefs>appearance>visual effects? ie. anything other than None
Yes.
If you set it to None, does it make a difference?
No not at all. :(
So its not a compositing or graphics issue.. something is wrong with your terminal
Well I installed the wm 'awsome' and then when I opened a terminal, tried both xterm and gnome-terminal it was just blank.. so I went back to gnome and uninstalled.. but nothing got better, sadly.
I dont know what is going on there.. maybe you can check your terminal profile?
Maybe the text color is the same as the background
no I wish so but my friend and I also ssh to this computer and we even could not write anything from there..  well yes we can write something but it has no effect..
Sounds like you broke your ubuntu ;)
Well the first thing to fixing it is identifying the problem. Unfortunately I have no idea how you broke it
Yea... well I installed the desktop manager 'awesome' and then afterwards my terminal went like "ka-booom"
MAybe you can try creating a new users
If another user is ok this points to a bad setting in your home folder
how do I create another user without my term?
I think there is user handling in sys>admin
I am kind of handicaped you see? without my term and all..
Obviously but I think the gui method is in sys>admin>users and groups
There, you would click Unlock then Add User
Then, log out and log back in as the new user
great! I will try that now (; thanks mate ! maybe I will be back! .. hopefully not. maybe with another problem sometime (:
